I would prefer to be fatherless because the damage of a lousy father would scar my personality far greater than being fatherless.	I think it's better to have a lousy father than to be fatherless because
column2: growing up without a father can be hard for some kids. For example
column3: there are some children that need dads to teach them right from wrong
column4: but as long as you have a father no matter how lousy he is
column5: at least you have somebody their to support your decisions and encourage you.

column1: arg35619_arg35635	A3QGFLKL2G6NJJ	a1	There is scientific evidence that shows having a mother and a father is the healthiest way for a child to progress physically and mentally. So a lousy father is better than none.(that is of course assuming that he is not abusive in any way) Also
column2: people change. Who says that he will be lousy forever. There are family therapy sessions you can attend to help.	I believe it is better to have a lousy father than to have none. It is important to have a role model to look up to and without that figure
